remap.inValue: PCS ActivePowerCmd - Preconditions were not met or failed to verify command was sent. View ESS Events page for more details
remap.note: Bit 0 - PCS ActivePowerCmd - Preconditions were not met or failed to verify command was sent. View ESS Events page for more details

ActivePowerCmd.note: Alarm variable that is triggered if sending active power command is unsuccessful

ClearFaults.note: Alarm variable that is triggered if sending clear faults command is unsuccessful

remap.note: Bit 0 - PCS ActivePower - Max Threshold Exceeded
Bit 1 - PCS DCVoltage - Max Threshold Exceeded
Bit 2 - PCS DCVoltage - Min Threshold Exceeded

MonitorVarAlarm.note1: Contains last recently reported alarm from any monitoring variable
MonitorVarAlarm.note2: Useful for reporting alarm states to an external management system (e.g. Site Controller) or modifying the alarm message before it is reported on the UI

remap.inValue: PCS VerifyActivePowerCmd - Command was sent, but the expected result was not observed before timeout

VerifyActivePowerCmd.note: Alarm variable that is triggered if the PCS's actual active power setpoint after sending the command is not expected

VerifyReactivePowerCmd.note: Alarm variable that is triggered if the PCS's actual reactive power setpoint after sending the command is not expected

remap.inValue: PCS VoltageSetpoint - Preconditions were not met or failed to verify command was sent. View ESS Events page for more details
remap.note: Bit 28 - PCS VoltageSetpoint - Preconditions were not met or failed to verify command was sent. View ESS Events page for more details

VoltageSetpoint.note: Alarm variable that is triggered if sending voltage setpoint command is unsuccessful

clear_alarms.note1: When this variable is set to Clear, all alarm variables (defined in /alarms/##PCS_ID##) will be reset to the normal state (defined in /config/##PCS_ID##:NoAlarmMsg)
clear_alarms.note2: Also, all monitoring variables (defined in variable) will have their alarm/fault states reset

remap.note: Bit 0 - PCS ActivePower - Max Threshold Exceeded
Bit 1 - PCS DCVoltage - Max Threshold Exceeded
Bit 2 - PCS DCVoltage - Min Threshold Exceeded

MonitorVarFault.note1: Contains last recently reported fault from any monitoring variable
MonitorVarFault.note2: Useful for reporting fault states to an external management system (e.g. Site Controller) or modifying the fault message before it is reported on the UI

clear_faults.note1: When this variable is set to Clear, all fault variables (defined in /faults/##PCS_ID##) will be reset to the normal state (defined in /config/##PCS_ID##:NoFaultMsg)
clear_faults.note2: Also, all monitoring variables (defined in variable) will have their alarm/fault states reset

ActivePower.note: Also a monitoring variable that reports an alarm/fault for over active power conditions

ClearFaultsDone.note: When this variable is set, the alarm/fault bitfields will be set to 0 to clear all bits

DCVoltage.note: Also a monitoring variable that reports an alarm/fault for over/under DC voltage conditions

FaultShutdown.note: When the PCS instance faults, the fault shutdown event will be propagated to its parent
